document.discussion_title: Ctrip.com International’s (CTRP) “Buy” Rating Reiterated at Nomura
document.topic_text: Tweet Ctrip.com International, Ltd. (NASDAQ:CTRP) ‘s stock had its “buy” rating reissued by equities research analysts at Nomura in a research note issued to investors on Monday, AnalystRatings.NET reports. Other equities research analysts have also issued reports about the company. Deutsche Bank lowered their price objective on Ctrip.com International to $55.70 in a research note on Wednesday, January 13th. Credit Agricole raised Ctrip.com International from an “underperform” rating to a “buy” rating in a research note on Thursday, February 18th. Summit Research reaffirmed a “buy” rating and issued a $62.50 price objective on shares of Ctrip.com International in a research note on Tuesday, February 16th. Oppenheimer reaffirmed a “buy” rating on shares of Ctrip.com International in a research note on Saturday, January 16th. Finally, Stifel Nicolaus reaffirmed a “buy” rating on shares of Ctrip.com International in a research note on Friday, January 22nd. Two investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have given a hold rating and eighteen have issued a buy rating to the stock. The company presently has an average rating of “Buy” and a consensus price target of $54.31. Ctrip.com International ( NASDAQ:CTRP ) traded down 2.14% during trading on Monday, reaching $46.11. 1,551,632 shares of the company’s stock were exchanged. The firm has a market cap of $13.05 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 42.97. The firm’s 50-day moving average price is $44.14 and its 200-day moving average price is $44.35. Ctrip.com International has a 12 month low of $27.25 and a 12 month high of $57.36. Ctrip.com International (NASDAQ:CTRP) last announced its quarterly earnings results on Wednesday, March 16th. The company reported $0.11 EPS for the quarter, beating analysts’ consensus estimates of ($0.05) by $0.16. On average, equities research analysts anticipate that Ctrip.com International will post ($2.73) EPS for the current year. A number of institutional investors recently added to or reduced their stakes in the stock. Verde Servico Internacionais bought a new position in Ctrip.com International during the fourth quarter valued at about $1,768,779,000. Fisher Asset Management increased its position in Ctrip.com International by 8.9% in the fourth quarter. Fisher Asset Management now owns 8,839,325 shares of the company’s stock valued at $409,526,000 after buying an additional 722,513 shares in the last quarter. Harding Loevner LP increased its position in Ctrip.com International by 96.8% in the fourth quarter. Harding Loevner LP now owns 6,841,976 shares of the company’s stock valued at $316,967,000 after buying an additional 3,365,519 shares in the last quarter. EQIS Capital Management bought a new position in Ctrip.com International during the fourth quarter valued at about $637,000. Finally, B.S. Pension Fund Trustee Ltd acting for the British Steel Pension Fund bought a new position in Ctrip.com International during the fourth quarter valued at about $584,000. Ctrip.com International, Ltd. is a travel service provider for hotel accommodations, transportation ticketing services, packaged tours and corporate travel management in China. The Company aggregates hotel and flight information to enable business and leisure travelers to make informed bookings. The Company also helps customers book tour packages and guided tours. //www.americanbankingnews.com/2016/04/25/ctrip-com-internationals-ctrp-buy-rating-reiterated-at-nomura/ Ctrip.com International Ltd. Ctrip.com International Ltd.
